attributes.name: EEG Neurofeedback
attributes.description: Feedback based on electroencephalography (EEG) signals, measuring electrical activity of the brain.

attributes.name: fMRI Neurofeedback
attributes.description: Feedback based on functional magnetic resonance imaging, measuring blood oxygen level-dependent (BOLD) response.

attributes.name: fNIRS Neurofeedback
attributes.description: Feedback based on functional near-infrared spectroscopy, measuring hemodynamic responses in the cortex.

attributes.name: MEG Neurofeedback
attributes.description: Feedback based on magnetoencephalography, measuring magnetic fields produced by electrical activity in the brain.

attributes.name: SMR Training
attributes.description: Sensorimotor rhythm training, typically enhancing 12-15 Hz activity over sensorimotor cortex.

attributes.name: Alpha Training
attributes.description: Enhancement of alpha rhythms (8-12 Hz), promoting relaxation and stress reduction.

attributes.name: Theta Training
attributes.description: Training focused on theta waves (4-8 Hz), often used for deep relaxation and memory enhancement.

attributes.name: Beta Training
attributes.description: Enhancement of beta activity (15-20 Hz), promoting focus and attention.

attributes.name: Alpha-Theta Training
attributes.description: Training that promotes transitions between alpha and theta states, used for trauma, addiction and PTSD treatment.

attributes.name: Infra-Low Frequency Training
attributes.description: Training of very slow brain oscillations below 0.5 Hz.

attributes.name: ADHD Treatment
attributes.description: Application of neurofeedback for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

attributes.name: Anxiety Treatment
attributes.description: Application of neurofeedback for anxiety disorders.

attributes.name: Epilepsy Treatment
attributes.description: Application of neurofeedback for seizure reduction in epilepsy.

attributes.name: Insomnia Treatment
attributes.description: Application of neurofeedback for sleep disorders.

attributes.name: PTSD Treatment
attributes.description: Application of neurofeedback for post-traumatic stress disorder.

attributes.name: M. Barry Sterman
attributes.description: Pioneer of SMR neurofeedback training, first demonstrated efficacy in treating epilepsy.
key_publications: Sterman, M. B., & Friar, L. (1972). Suppression of seizures in an epileptic following sensorimotor EEG feedback training.
Sterman, M. B. (2000). Basic concepts and clinical findings in the treatment of seizure disorders with EEG operant conditioning.

attributes.name: Joel F. Lubar
attributes.description: Pioneer in applying neurofeedback to ADHD treatment.
key_publications: Lubar, J. F., & Shouse, M. N. (1976). EEG and behavioral changes in a hyperkinetic child concurrent with training of the sensorimotor rhythm (SMR).
Lubar, J. F. (1991). Discourse on the development of EEG diagnostics and biofeedback for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorders.

attributes.name: Eugene G. Peniston
attributes.description: Developer of the Peniston Protocol (alpha-theta training) for alcoholism and PTSD.
key_publications: Peniston, E. G., & Kulkosky, P. J. (1989). Alpha-theta brainwave training and beta-endorphin levels in alcoholics.
Peniston, E. G., & Kulkosky, P. J. (1991). Alpha-theta brainwave neurofeedback for Vietnam veterans with combat-related post-traumatic stress disorder.

attributes.name: Siegfried Othmer
attributes.description: Developer of infra-low frequency neurofeedback and clinical researcher.
key_publications: Othmer, S., Othmer, S. F., & Kaiser, D. A. (1999). EEG biofeedback: An emerging model for its global efficacy.
Othmer, S., & Othmer, S. F. (2009). Post traumatic stress disorder—The neurofeedback remedy.

attributes.name: EEG Amplifier
attributes.description: Device for amplifying and digitizing EEG signals from electrodes.

attributes.name: EEG Cap/Headset
attributes.description: Wearable cap or headset containing electrodes for EEG recording.
attributes.development_trends: Dry electrode technology, faster setup, increased comfort

attributes.name: Neurofeedback Software
attributes.description: Software for signal processing, feedback generation, and session management.
attributes.development_trends: Cloud integration, AI-assisted protocol selection, improved visualizations

attributes.title: Suppression of seizures in an epileptic following sensorimotor EEG feedback training
key_findings: First demonstration of SMR training reducing seizure frequency
Established foundation for neurofeedback in epilepsy treatment
attributes.methodology: Single case design with a female subject with epilepsy

attributes.title: EEG and behavioral changes in a hyperkinetic child concurrent with training of the sensorimotor rhythm (SMR)
key_findings: First application of SMR training to ADHD symptoms
Showed reversal of effects when training was reversed
attributes.methodology: ABA reversal design with a single hyperkinetic child

attributes.title: Alpha-theta brainwave training and beta-endorphin levels in alcoholics
key_findings: Alpha-theta training reduced depression and anxiety in alcoholics
Observed significant increases in beta-endorphin levels

attributes.title: Neurophysiological predictors of non-response to rTMS in depression
key_findings: EEG alpha asymmetry predicted response to rTMS treatment
Integration of neurofeedback with other neuromodulation techniques
Personalized treatment approaches based on QEEG

attributes.name: Operant Conditioning
attributes.description: Learning framework where behavior is modified by consequences, applied to brain activity in neurofeedback.
attributes.relevance: Provides core theoretical foundation for neurofeedback as a learning process

attributes.name: Neuroplasticity
attributes.description: Brain's ability to reorganize itself by forming new neural connections, the basis for long-term neurofeedback effects.
attributes.relevance: Explains the lasting changes in brain function that result from neurofeedback training

attributes.name: Arousal Model of Neurofeedback
attributes.description: Framework explaining neurofeedback effects through optimizing cortical arousal levels.
attributes.relevance: Particularly relevant for ADHD, anxiety, and performance applications

attributes.description: EEG neurofeedback is the primary modality for implementing SMR training
EEG neurofeedback is the primary modality for implementing alpha training
EEG neurofeedback is the primary modality for implementing beta training
EEG neurofeedback is the primary modality for implementing theta training
EEG neurofeedback is used for implementing infra-low frequency training
fMRI can be used for alpha state training, but less commonly than EEG
SMR training is commonly used for ADHD treatment
Beta training is commonly used for ADHD treatment
Alpha training is frequently used for anxiety treatment
SMR training was originally developed for and is still used in epilepsy treatment
Alpha-theta training is a core protocol for PTSD treatment
Infra-low frequency training is increasingly used for complex trauma and PTSD
Sterman developed SMR training through his work with cats and later humans with epilepsy
Lubar pioneered the application of beta training protocols for ADHD
Peniston developed the alpha-theta protocol for alcoholism and PTSD
Othmer pioneered infra-low frequency training for various clinical applications
Sterman led this groundbreaking study on neurofeedback for epilepsy
Lubar conducted this seminal study applying neurofeedback to ADHD
Peniston led this influential study on alpha-theta training for alcoholism
EEG amplifiers are essential hardware components for EEG neurofeedback
EEG caps/headsets are required to collect brain signals for neurofeedback
Neurofeedback software provides the algorithmic implementation of SMR training protocols
Neurofeedback software provides the algorithmic implementation of alpha training protocols
Operant conditioning provides the theoretical basis for how SMR training works
Neuroplasticity explains the long-term brain changes that result from neurofeedback training
The arousal model helps explain why neurofeedback is effective for ADHD

    <node id="eeg-neurofeedback">
      <data key="type">modality</data>
      <data key="name">EEG Neurofeedback</data>
      <data key="description">Feedback based on electroencephalography (EEG) signals, measuring electrical activity of the brain.</data>
      <data key="discovery_year">1968</data>
      <data key="signal_type">electrical</data>
      <data key="measurement_location">scalp</data>
      <data key="temporal_resolution">milliseconds</data>
      <data key="spatial_resolution">centimeters</data>
      <data key="cost_effectiveness">high</data>
      <data key="portability">medium to high</data>
    </node>
    <node id="fmri-neurofeedback">
      <data key="type">modality</data>
      <data key="name">fMRI Neurofeedback</data>
      <data key="description">Feedback based on functional magnetic resonance imaging, measuring blood oxygen level-dependent (BOLD) response.</data>
      <data key="discovery_year">1995</data>
      <data key="signal_type">hemodynamic</data>
      <data key="measurement_location">whole brain</data>
      <data key="temporal_resolution">seconds</data>
      <data key="spatial_resolution">millimeters</data>
      <data key="cost_effectiveness">low</data>
      <data key="portability">low</data>
    </node>
    <node id="fnirs-neurofeedback">
      <data key="type">modality</data>
      <data key="name">fNIRS Neurofeedback</data>
      <data key="description">Feedback based on functional near-infrared spectroscopy, measuring hemodynamic responses in the cortex.</data>
      <data key="discovery_year">2004</data>
      <data key="signal_type">hemodynamic</data>
      <data key="measurement_location">cortical surface</data>
      <data key="temporal_resolution">seconds</data>
      <data key="spatial_resolution">centimeters</data>
      <data key="cost_effectiveness">medium</data>
      <data key="portability">medium to high</data>
    </node>
    <node id="meg-neurofeedback">
      <data key="type">modality</data>
      <data key="name">MEG Neurofeedback</data>
      <data key="description">Feedback based on magnetoencephalography, measuring magnetic fields produced by electrical activity in the brain.</data>
      <data key="discovery_year">1998</data>
      <data key="signal_type">magnetic</data>
      <data key="measurement_location">whole head</data>
      <data key="temporal_resolution">milliseconds</data>
      <data key="spatial_resolution">centimeters</data>
      <data key="cost_effectiveness">very low</data>
      <data key="portability">very low</data>
    </node>
    <node id="smr-training">
      <data key="type">protocol</data>
      <data key="name">SMR Training</data>
      <data key="description">Sensorimotor rhythm training, typically enhancing 12-15 Hz activity over sensorimotor cortex.</data>
      <data key="target_frequency">12-15 Hz</data>
      <data key="typical_locations">C3,C4,Cz</data>
      <data key="typical_applications">ADHD,Epilepsy,Sleep disorders</data>
      <data key="development_year">1972</data>
      <data key="evidence_level">high</data>
    </node>
    <node id="alpha-training">
      <data key="type">protocol</data>
      <data key="name">Alpha Training</data>
      <data key="description">Enhancement of alpha rhythms (8-12 Hz), promoting relaxation and stress reduction.</data>
      <data key="target_frequency">8-12 Hz</data>
      <data key="typical_locations">O1,O2,P3,P4</data>
      <data key="typical_applications">Anxiety,Stress,Creativity enhancement</data>
      <data key="development_year">1968</data>
      <data key="evidence_level">medium</data>
    </node>
    <node id="theta-training">
      <data key="type">protocol</data>
      <data key="name">Theta Training</data>
      <data key="description">Training focused on theta waves (4-8 Hz), often used for deep relaxation and memory enhancement.</data>
      <data key="target_frequency">4-8 Hz</data>
      <data key="typical_locations">Fz,Pz</data>
      <data key="typical_applications">Memory enhancement,Deep relaxation,Trauma treatment</data>
      <data key="development_year">1975</data>
      <data key="evidence_level">medium</data>
    </node>
    <node id="beta-training">
      <data key="type">protocol</data>
      <data key="name">Beta Training</data>
      <data key="description">Enhancement of beta activity (15-20 Hz), promoting focus and attention.</data>
      <data key="target_frequency">15-20 Hz</data>
      <data key="typical_locations">F3,F4,Fz</data>
      <data key="typical_applications">ADHD,Cognitive enhancement,Performance optimization</data>
      <data key="development_year">1976</data>
      <data key="evidence_level">high</data>
    </node>
    <node id="alpha-theta-training">
      <data key="type">protocol</data>
      <data key="name">Alpha-Theta Training</data>
      <data key="description">Training that promotes transitions between alpha and theta states, used for trauma, addiction and PTSD treatment.</data>
      <data key="target_frequency">4-12 Hz</data>
      <data key="typical_locations">Pz,Oz</data>
      <data key="typical_applications">PTSD,Addiction,Trauma recovery,Peak performance</data>
      <data key="development_year">1989</data>
      <data key="evidence_level">medium</data>
    </node>
    <node id="infra-low-frequency">
      <data key="type">protocol</data>
      <data key="name">Infra-Low Frequency Training</data>
      <data key="description">Training of very slow brain oscillations below 0.5 Hz.</data>
      <data key="target_frequency"><0.5 Hz</data>
      <data key="typical_locations">T3,T4,Fp1,Fp2</data>
      <data key="typical_applications">Complex trauma,Mood disorders,Migraine</data>
      <data key="development_year">2006</data>
      <data key="evidence_level">medium</data>
    </node>
    <node id="adhd-treatment">
      <data key="type">clinical_application</data>
      <data key="name">ADHD Treatment</data>
      <data key="description">Application of neurofeedback for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.</data>
      <data key="target_symptoms">Inattention,Hyperactivity,Impulsivity</data>
      <data key="typical_protocols">smr-training,beta-training,theta-beta-ratio</data>
      <data key="efficacy_rating">Level 5 - Efficacious and Specific</data>
      <data key="research_volume">high</data>
      <data key="typical_session_count">30-40</data>
    </node>
    <node id="anxiety-treatment">
      <data key="type">clinical_application</data>
      <data key="name">Anxiety Treatment</data>
      <data key="description">Application of neurofeedback for anxiety disorders.</data>
      <data key="target_symptoms">Excessive worry,Physiological arousal,Avoidance behavior</data>
      <data key="typical_protocols">alpha-training,alpha-theta-training</data>
      <data key="efficacy_rating">Level 4 - Efficacious</data>
      <data key="research_volume">medium</data>
      <data key="typical_session_count">20-30</data>
    </node>
    <node id="epilepsy-treatment">
      <data key="type">clinical_application</data>
      <data key="name">Epilepsy Treatment</data>
      <data key="description">Application of neurofeedback for seizure reduction in epilepsy.</data>
      <data key="target_symptoms">Seizure frequency,Seizure intensity</data>
      <data key="typical_protocols">smr-training,slow-cortical-potentials</data>
      <data key="efficacy_rating">Level 4 - Efficacious</data>
      <data key="research_volume">medium</data>
      <data key="typical_session_count">30-40</data>
    </node>
    <node id="insomnia-treatment">
      <data key="type">clinical_application</data>
      <data key="name">Insomnia Treatment</data>
      <data key="description">Application of neurofeedback for sleep disorders.</data>
      <data key="target_symptoms">Sleep onset latency,Sleep maintenance,Sleep quality</data>
      <data key="typical_protocols">smr-training,z-score-training</data>
      <data key="efficacy_rating">Level 3 - Probably Efficacious</data>
      <data key="research_volume">low</data>
      <data key="typical_session_count">20-30</data>
    </node>
    <node id="ptsd-treatment">
      <data key="type">clinical_application</data>
      <data key="name">PTSD Treatment</data>
      <data key="description">Application of neurofeedback for post-traumatic stress disorder.</data>
      <data key="target_symptoms">Intrusive memories,Hyperarousal,Emotional dysregulation</data>
      <data key="typical_protocols">alpha-theta-training,infra-low-frequency</data>
      <data key="efficacy_rating">Level 3 - Probably Efficacious</data>
      <data key="research_volume">medium</data>
      <data key="typical_session_count">30-50</data>
    </node>
    <node id="sterman-mb">
      <data key="type">researcher</data>
      <data key="name">M. Barry Sterman</data>
      <data key="description">Pioneer of SMR neurofeedback training, first demonstrated efficacy in treating epilepsy.</data>
      <data key="affiliation">University of California, Los Angeles</data>
      <data key="key_contributions">Discovery of SMR,EEG biofeedback for epilepsy,Sleep research</data>
      <data key="active_years">1967-2010</data>
      <data key="key_publications">Sterman, M. B., & Friar, L. (1972). Suppression of seizures in an epileptic following sensorimotor EEG feedback training.,Sterman, M. B. (2000). Basic concepts and clinical findings in the treatment of seizure disorders with EEG operant conditioning.</data>
    </node>
    <node id="lubar-jf">
      <data key="type">researcher</data>
      <data key="name">Joel F. Lubar</data>
      <data key="description">Pioneer in applying neurofeedback to ADHD treatment.</data>
      <data key="affiliation">University of Tennessee</data>
      <data key="key_contributions">ADHD neurofeedback protocols,Theta/Beta ratio,Quantitative EEG assessment</data>
      <data key="active_years">1976-2010</data>
      <data key="key_publications">Lubar, J. F., & Shouse, M. N. (1976). EEG and behavioral changes in a hyperkinetic child concurrent with training of the sensorimotor rhythm (SMR).,Lubar, J. F. (1991). Discourse on the development of EEG diagnostics and biofeedback for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorders.</data>
    </node>
    <node id="peniston-eg">
      <data key="type">researcher</data>
      <data key="name">Eugene G. Peniston</data>
      <data key="description">Developer of the Peniston Protocol (alpha-theta training) for alcoholism and PTSD.</data>
      <data key="affiliation">Veterans Administration Hospital, Fort Lyon</data>
      <data key="key_contributions">Alpha-Theta protocol,PTSD treatment,Substance abuse applications</data>
      <data key="active_years">1989-2005</data>
      <data key="key_publications">Peniston, E. G., & Kulkosky, P. J. (1989). Alpha-theta brainwave training and beta-endorphin levels in alcoholics.,Peniston, E. G., & Kulkosky, P. J. (1991). Alpha-theta brainwave neurofeedback for Vietnam veterans with combat-related post-traumatic stress disorder.</data>
    </node>
    <node id="othmer-sf">
      <data key="type">researcher</data>
      <data key="name">Siegfried Othmer</data>
      <data key="description">Developer of infra-low frequency neurofeedback and clinical researcher.</data>
      <data key="affiliation">EEG Institute</data>
      <data key="key_contributions">Infra-low frequency training,Clinical applications across disorders,Neurofeedback technology development</data>
      <data key="active_years">1985-present</data>
      <data key="key_publications">Othmer, S., Othmer, S. F., & Kaiser, D. A. (1999). EEG biofeedback: An emerging model for its global efficacy.,Othmer, S., & Othmer, S. F. (2009). Post traumatic stress disorder—The neurofeedback remedy.</data>
    </node>
    <node id="eeg-amplifier">
      <data key="type">equipment</data>
      <data key="name">EEG Amplifier</data>
      <data key="description">Device for amplifying and digitizing EEG signals from electrodes.</data>
      <data key="types">Research grade,Clinical grade,Consumer grade</data>
      <data key="key_specifications">Number of channels,Sampling rate,Resolution,Noise level</data>
      <data key="typical_cost_range">$500 - $50,000</data>
      <data key="development_trends">Increasingly wireless, mobile, and user-friendly</data>
    </node>
    <node id="eeg-cap">
      <data key="type">equipment</data>
      <data key="name">EEG Cap/Headset</data>
      <data key="description">Wearable cap or headset containing electrodes for EEG recording.</data>
      <data key="types">Wet electrode caps,Dry electrode headsets,Hybrid systems</data>
      <data key="key_specifications">Number of electrodes,Electrode material,Comfort,Setup time</data>
      <data key="typical_cost_range">$200 - $5,000</data>
      <data key="development_trends">Dry electrode technology, faster setup, increased comfort</data>
    </node>
    <node id="nf-software">
      <data key="type">equipment</data>
      <data key="name">Neurofeedback Software</data>
      <data key="description">Software for signal processing, feedback generation, and session management.</data>
      <data key="types">Clinical systems,Research platforms,Consumer applications</data>
      <data key="key_specifications">Signal processing capabilities,Protocol flexibility,Data management,User interface</data>
      <data key="typical_cost_range">$0 (open-source) - $15,000</data>
      <data key="development_trends">Cloud integration, AI-assisted protocol selection, improved visualizations</data>
    </node>
    <node id="sterman-epilepsy-1972">
      <data key="type">research_study</data>
      <data key="title">Suppression of seizures in an epileptic following sensorimotor EEG feedback training</data>
      <data key="authors">sterman-mb,Friar, L.</data>
      <data key="year">1972</data>
      <data key="journal">Electroencephalography and Clinical Neurophysiology</data>
      <data key="key_findings">First demonstration of SMR training reducing seizure frequency,Established foundation for neurofeedback in epilepsy treatment</data>
      <data key="methodology">Single case design with a female subject with epilepsy</data>
      <data key="citation_count">476</data>
      <data key="study_type">clinical case study</data>
    </node>
    <node id="lubar-adhd-1976">
      <data key="type">research_study</data>
      <data key="title">EEG and behavioral changes in a hyperkinetic child concurrent with training of the sensorimotor rhythm (SMR)</data>
      <data key="authors">lubar-jf,Shouse, M.N.</data>
      <data key="year">1976</data>
      <data key="journal">Biofeedback and Self-regulation</data>
      <data key="key_findings">First application of SMR training to ADHD symptoms,Demonstrated reduction in hyperactivity,Showed reversal of effects when training was reversed</data>
      <data key="methodology">ABA reversal design with a single hyperkinetic child</data>
      <data key="citation_count">543</data>
      <data key="study_type">clinical case study</data>
    </node>
    <node id="peniston-alcoholism-1989">
      <data key="type">research_study</data>
      <data key="title">Alpha-theta brainwave training and beta-endorphin levels in alcoholics</data>
      <data key="authors">peniston-eg,Kulkosky, P.J.</data>
      <data key="year">1989</data>
      <data key="journal">Alcoholism: Clinical and Experimental Research</data>
      <data key="key_findings">Alpha-theta training reduced depression and anxiety in alcoholics,Observed significant increases in beta-endorphin levels,Demonstrated 13-month abstinence in treatment group</data>
      <data key="methodology">Controlled study with alcoholic participants</data>
      <data key="citation_count">312</data>
      <data key="study_type">controlled clinical trial</data>
    </node>
    <node id="arns-tdcs-2012">
      <data key="type">research_study</data>
      <data key="title">Neurophysiological predictors of non-response to rTMS in depression</data>
      <data key="authors">Arns, M.,Several others</data>
      <data key="year">2012</data>
      <data key="journal">Journal of Affective Disorders</data>
      <data key="key_findings">EEG alpha asymmetry predicted response to rTMS treatment,Integration of neurofeedback with other neuromodulation techniques,Personalized treatment approaches based on QEEG</data>
      <data key="methodology">Retrospective analysis of treatment outcomes</data>
      <data key="citation_count">227</data>
      <data key="study_type">retrospective analysis</data>
    </node>
    <node id="operant-conditioning">
      <data key="type">theoretical_framework</data>
      <data key="name">Operant Conditioning</data>
      <data key="description">Learning framework where behavior is modified by consequences, applied to brain activity in neurofeedback.</data>
      <data key="key_concepts">Reinforcement,Instrumental learning,Behavior shaping</data>
      <data key="originators">B.F. Skinner</data>
      <data key="relevance">Provides core theoretical foundation for neurofeedback as a learning process</data>
    </node>
    <node id="neuroplasticity">
      <data key="type">theoretical_framework</data>
      <data key="name">Neuroplasticity</data>
      <data key="description">Brain's ability to reorganize itself by forming new neural connections, the basis for long-term neurofeedback effects.</data>
      <data key="key_concepts">Hebbian learning,Synaptic plasticity,Neural reorganization</data>
      <data key="originators">Donald Hebb,Michael Merzenich</data>
      <data key="relevance">Explains the lasting changes in brain function that result from neurofeedback training</data>
    </node>
    <node id="arousal-model">
      <data key="type">theoretical_framework</data>
      <data key="name">Arousal Model of Neurofeedback</data>
      <data key="description">Framework explaining neurofeedback effects through optimizing cortical arousal levels.</data>
      <data key="key_concepts">Optimal arousal,Over/under-arousal,Performance optimization</data>
      <data key="originators">Karl Pribram,Barry Sterman</data>
      <data key="relevance">Particularly relevant for ADHD, anxiety, and performance applications</data>
    </node>
    <edge source="eeg-neurofeedback" target="smr-training">
      <data key="relationship_type">implements</data>

;; UltraLink Knowledge Interchange Format (KIF) Export
;; Generated: 2025-03-09T18:52:13.753Z

;; Meta-knowledge
(= (creationDate UltraLinkExport) "2025-03-09T18:52:13.753Z")
(= (entityCount UltraLinkExport) 29)
(= (relationshipCount UltraLinkExport) 26)

;; Functions
(deffunction relationshipCount (?x) (length ?kb.relationships))

;; Rules
(defrule entity-attributes-rule
    "A rule to infer additional attributes for entities based on their type"
    (instance ?entity ?type)
    =>
    (if (eq ?type Person)
        then (assert (isAgent ?entity true))))

(forall (?x ?y)
    (=> (and (adapts_to ?x ?y) (> (efficiency-adapts_to ?x ?y) 0.8))
        (well-adapted ?x ?y)))

;; Entities and their attributes
(instance eeg-neurofeedback Modality)
(name eeg-neurofeedback "EEG Neurofeedback")
(description eeg-neurofeedback "Feedback based on electroencephalography (EEG) signals, measuring electrical activity of the brain.")
(discovery_year eeg-neurofeedback 1968)
(signal_type eeg-neurofeedback "electrical")
(measurement_location eeg-neurofeedback "scalp")
(temporal_resolution eeg-neurofeedback "milliseconds")
(spatial_resolution eeg-neurofeedback "centimeters")
(cost_effectiveness eeg-neurofeedback "high")
(portability eeg-neurofeedback "medium to high")

(instance fmri-neurofeedback Modality)
(name fmri-neurofeedback "fMRI Neurofeedback")
(description fmri-neurofeedback "Feedback based on functional magnetic resonance imaging, measuring blood oxygen level-dependent (BOLD) response.")
(discovery_year fmri-neurofeedback 1995)
(signal_type fmri-neurofeedback "hemodynamic")
(measurement_location fmri-neurofeedback "whole brain")
(temporal_resolution fmri-neurofeedback "seconds")
(spatial_resolution fmri-neurofeedback "millimeters")
(cost_effectiveness fmri-neurofeedback "low")
(portability fmri-neurofeedback "low")

(instance fnirs-neurofeedback Modality)

(signal_type fnirs-neurofeedback "hemodynamic")
(measurement_location fnirs-neurofeedback "cortical surface")
(temporal_resolution fnirs-neurofeedback "seconds")
(spatial_resolution fnirs-neurofeedback "centimeters")
(cost_effectiveness fnirs-neurofeedback "medium")
(portability fnirs-neurofeedback "medium to high")

(instance meg-neurofeedback Modality)

(signal_type meg-neurofeedback "magnetic")
(measurement_location meg-neurofeedback "whole head")
(temporal_resolution meg-neurofeedback "milliseconds")
(spatial_resolution meg-neurofeedback "centimeters")
(cost_effectiveness meg-neurofeedback "very low")
(portability meg-neurofeedback "very low")

(instance smr-training Protocol)

(target_frequency smr-training "12-15 Hz")
(typical_locations smr-training "[\"C3\",\"C4\",\"Cz\"]")
(typical_applications smr-training "[\"ADHD\",\"Epilepsy\",\"Sleep disorders\"]")
(development_year smr-training 1972)
(evidence_level smr-training "high")

(instance alpha-training Protocol)

(typical_applications alpha-training "[\"Anxiety\",\"Stress\",\"Creativity enhancement\"]")
(development_year alpha-training 1968)
